summary: This is an email exchange between FBI personnel and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding securing seats for FBI leadership to attend a hearing related to Jeffrey Epstein. It shows coordination between law enforcement agencies on the case shortly after Epstein's death.

persons.name: SSA - Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FBI New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting seats for FBI leadership to attend the Epstein hearing.

persons.name: ADIC
persons.context: FBI leadership figure who, along with the SAC, wishes to attend the Epstein hearing.

persons.name: SAC
persons.context: FBI leadership figure who, along with the ADIC, wishes to attend the Epstein hearing.

connections.person1: SSA - Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FBI New York
connections.description: The SSA is coordinating attendance for the ADIC at the Epstein hearing, indicating a chain of command relationship.

connections.person1: SSA - Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FBI New York
connections.description: The SSA is coordinating attendance for the SAC at the Epstein hearing, indicating a chain of command relationship.
Both are senior FBI leadership figures seeking to attend the same hearing together.

events.title: Epstein Hearing
events.description: A court hearing related to the Jeffrey Epstein case, occurring the day after this email was sent. FBI leadership sought to attend.
personsInvolved: SSA - Squad C-20 Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking FBI New York

keyFacts: The email is dated August 26, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
FBI leadership (ADIC and SAC) expressed direct interest in attending a hearing related to the Epstein case.
The coordination involves the FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad (C-20) and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS).
The document demonstrates ongoing legal proceedings and high-level law enforcement attention on the Epstein case post-mortem.
The subject line and context confirm the hearing was specifically regarding 'Epstein'.
